intro: Mitostemma jenmanii, commonly known as the Jenman's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and fleshy, red berries. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its specialized haustoria attached to the host. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid forest environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
